content.description: Seldom climbed.  Starts on the face left of the chimney separating Sunday and Everyday buttresses. Balancy climbing on thin edges and sidepulls straight up leads to a tricky short crack (crux)above the roof. Avoid the temptation to wander right and use the left edge of the chimney.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds toprope (long slings helpful)

content.description: Climbs the flaring short crack above the lower overhang.  Start a few feet left of Balcony Center going up the black face.  Engage the crack and sloping edges (crux) up to the balcony.  Finish up the left side of the balcony.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds toprope, long slings may be helpful.

content.description: Starts about 15 feet right of Balcony Right directly under a large protruding block on top of the cliff.  Face climb up to a break in the roof which initially includes a right-facing corner.  Crank over the roof (crux) head towards the right side of the overhanging block on top.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds toprope or lead with small to medium nuts/cams.

content.description: Very popular.  Begins underneath the right edge of the balcony going straight up the crack and shallow corner (crux).  Continue over the right edge of the balcony's roof.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds toprope (long slings helpful) or leadable with nuts, hexes, and small to midsized cams.

content.description: A must do at Blue Mounds.  As the name implies start up the crack and edges below the middle of the "balcony", muscle up on big flat edges.  Finish up the tricky center of the balcony roof (crux).
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds setup, long slings may be helpful but not necessary for this one.

content.description:
Named because of the occassional presence of a bat in the flare of No Go Crack.  Balcony Left would have been a more fitting choice. 

  Start about 5 feet left of No Go Crack or about 12 left of Balcony Center. Move up to the roof and try to find the fingertip edges above it.  Crank up or jump to the next set of edges.  Finishes up the small right facing crack/corner just left of the Balcony's left edge.

Sunday buttress is located between Midnight Buttress and Everyday Buttress.  This area contains a concentration of fun routes in the 5.10 range centered around a large ledge the "balcony".  This area is easily identified by this landmark.
